Covering Fire (Critical Success).name: Covering Fire (Critical Success)
Covering Fire (Critical Success).description: Cannot take reactions triggered by maneuver war actions from any army until the start of your next turn.

False Retreat (Critical Success).name: False Retreat (Critical Success)
False Retreat (Critical Success).description: The target is unable to take reactions until the start of your next turn.

Reckless Flankers.name: Reckless Flankers
Reckless Flankers.description: Take a –2 circumstance penalty to your AC in order to gain a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls. If you do so, these modifiers remain in effect until you are no longer engaged.

Post Snipers (Critical Failure).name: Post Snipers (Critical Failure)
Post Snipers (Critical Failure).description: Not only are the snipers posted in areas that end up not proving advantageous, but the PCs drew too many archers from the ranks. The Narlmarch Hunters suffer a –2 penalty on ranged attacks during the Battle for Tatzlford.

Advantageous Positioning.name: Advantageous Positioning
Advantageous Positioning.description: Being able to fight in and around the houses of Tatzlford and its defenses grants armies that start the War encounter defending the town a +2 item bonus to AC and to saving throws for the first 3 turns.

Erect Barricades (Critical Success).name: Erect Barricades (Critical Success)
Erect Barricades (Critical Success).description: The barricade is a success. When a defending army takes the Guard action, it gains a +2 item bonus on its Maneuver check. A barricade can grant this bonus only twice before it is ruined by enemy attacks.

Erect Barricades (Success).name: Erect Barricades (Success)
Erect Barricades (Success).description: The barricade is a success. When a defending army takes the Guard action, it gains a +2 item bonus on its Maneuver check. A barricade can grant this bonus only once before it is ruined by enemy attacks.

Recruit Wildlife (Critical Success).name: Recruit Wildlife (Critical Success)
Recruit Wildlife (Critical Success).description:
The PCs interpret animal reactions to the enemy armies’ approach, giving their armies a +3 circumstance bonus on initiative checks made during the Battle for Tatzlford.

In addition, at one point during the battle, a pack of hungry brush thylacines attack an enemy army. This attack takes place at the end of a turn chosen by the party, at which point the PCs can attempt a [[/r 1d20+20]] melee Strike against any non-engaged army. The thylacines do [[/r 1]] point of damage to that army on a hit (or [[/r 2]] points on a critical hit) before the animals flee back into the woods.

Recruit Wildlife (Success).description:
The PCs interpret animal reactions to the enemy armies’ approach, giving their armies a +1 circumstance bonus on initiative checks made during the Battle for Tatzlford.

In addition, at one point during the battle, a pack of hungry brush thylacines attack an enemy army. This attack takes place at the end of a turn chosen by the party, at which point the PCs can attempt a [[/r 1d20+20]] melee Strike against any non-engaged army. The thylacines do [[/r 1]] point of damage to that army on a hit (or [[/r 2]] points on a critical hit) before the animals flee back into the woods.

The Skunk River.name: The Skunk River
The Skunk River.description:
Attacking armies who approach from the north must contend with the Skunk River, and on the first 2 turns of the War encounter are treated as
if they are in difficult terrain—they take a –2 penalty on Maneuver checks during these first two turns.
